edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.namerecognizer
Class Names

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.namerecognizer.Names

public class Names
extends java.lang.Object

Extract person and place names from text.

Uses lists of first names, surnames, and geographic locations to extract person names and locations from text.

Based in part on code written by Mark Watson.

acceptName

protected boolean acceptName(Lexicon lexicon,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             boolean firstWord,
                             int numWords)
Accept a name.

Parameters:
lexicon - Word lexicon.
name - The text of the name.
firstWord - True if the name starts with the first word in a sentence.
numWords - The number of words in the name.
Returns:
true if the name should be accepted as such.

getProperNames

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String>[] getProperNames(java.lang.String[] words,
                                                        Lexicon lexicon)
Extract all proper names for people and places from a list of words.

Parameters:
words - String array of words to search for names. This should correspond to a single sentence.
lexicon - Lexicon for filtering names.
Returns:
Two element array containing two sets. First set is a list of person names. Second set is a list of place names.

Parameters:
s - String to search for names. This should correspond to a single sentence.
lexicon - Lexicon for filtering names.
Returns:
Two element array containing two sets. First set is a list of person names. Second set is a list of place names.

getProperNames

                                                        Lexicon lexicon)
Extract all proper names for people and places from a sstring.

Parameters:
wordsList - List of words to search for names. This should correspond to a single sentence.
lexicon - Lexicon for filtering names.
Returns:
Two element array containing two sets. First set is a list of person names. Second set is a list of place names.

Get a place name from a list of words.

Parameters:

Returns:
The place name, if found, or an empty string if not found.
